section.title: <plotter>
section.para: This element is for plotting graphs. It represents a specialized handy frontend for the <canvas> by taking value by value.

row.entry: Enables scaling of the lower boundary, so negative values won't 'drop off'.
Enables a hold-function on the scaling. When the scaling is changed because of large values, it will not return to the default scaling once those large values have disappeared from the history.
The numbers of values stored in the history.
The next value to append to the history of values. Values may range from 0 to 100, but if you supply values greater than 100, the graph will scale accordingly.

section.title: Examples
section.programlisting:
<display bg-color="white" anchor="center" x="50%" y="50%">
<control id="sys" interface="ISystem:4i4p0jtvdz87qx44x2dm97ltj"/>
<plotter width="100" height="100" size="100" id="plotter" color="black"/>
<script><![CDATA[
def cpu_handler(): Dsp.plotter.value = sys.cpu_load return True
add_timer(500, cpu_handler)
]]></script>
</display>
